titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The rain mingled with snow fell heavily most of the morning. It snowed during the night. It is announced in the "
that Arthur Headlam has been appointed Regius Professor at Oxford in succession to Scott Holland
. I wrote a number of letters: visited the barber, and the book–seller: lunched in the Athenaeum, where Matheson shared my table, and finally addressed myself to preparing for my function in the
. The detestable weather kept many people away, but the building was at least two–thirds filled at 4 p.m. when I preached.
was on the platform. Later I returned to the place for the meeting. The Chapel was almost full. My speech was half an hour in delivery, & was a poor confused thing.
I said that I wished to make clear to everybody that as bishop I intended to pursue the object which I had pursued in less exalted positions
